content:
• Tuesday, November 27, 2012
  • CLH

    Clean Harbors (NYSE:CLH) prices its previously announced 6M share offering at $56, just a 1.7%...

    Clean Harbors (NYSE:CLH) prices its previously announced 6M share offering at $56, just a 1.7% discount to todays closing price. The company intends to use the proceeds to help finance its $1.25B acquisition of Safety-Kleen (OTC:SFYK), and also plans to offer $550M in senior notes due 2021 to help fund the deal. CLH had around 53.4M shares outstanding as of September 30. Shares -1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:56 PM
  • GMCR

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: GMCR +23.3%. CIG +3.8%. CBOU +2/7%. PFPT +2.7%. ANN...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: GMCR +23.3%. CIG +3.8%. CBOU +2/7%. PFPT +2.7%. ANN +2.4%. After-hours top losers: CWTR -5.7%. MJN -3.3%. ADI -3.2%. IGT -3.1%. ODP -2.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM
  • JVA

    Coffee Holding Co. (NASDAQ:JVA) +8.4% AH in response to Green Mountain's FQ4 beat and...

    Coffee Holding Co. (NASDAQ:JVA) +8.4% AH in response to Green Mountain's FQ4 beat and above-consensus FQ1 guidance. JVA derives a huge chunk of its sales from Green Mountain, and the two companies have a long history of moving in the same direction.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • FMCN

    Focus Media (NASDAQ:FMCN): FQ4 EPS of $0.71 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $256.3M (+23% Y/Y)...

    Focus Media (NASDAQ:FMCN): FQ4 EPS of $0.71 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $256.3M (+23% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) +3.3% AH after Kara Swisher reports several board members have been...

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) +3.3% AH after Kara Swisher reports several board members have been thinking of ousting CEO Andrew Mason in favor of a "more experienced" leader, as well as making other changes. However, she cautions Mason has support on Groupon's board, and is unlikely to be replaced immediately. Management issues are expected to be brought up at a board meeting later this week. Mason has taken plenty of heat for Groupon's post-IPO performance. (COO appointment)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • GWRE

    Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE): FQ1 EPS of $0.11 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $63.3M (+21% Y/Y)...

    Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE): FQ1 EPS of $0.11 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $63.3M (+21% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares +5.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • ADI

    Analog Devices (NASDAQ:ADI): FQ4 EPS of $0.58 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $694.9M (-3% Y/Y)...

    Analog Devices (NASDAQ:ADI): FQ4 EPS of $0.58 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $694.9M (-3% Y/Y) misses by $3M. Shares -2.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR): FQ4 EPS of $0.64 beats by $0.16. Revenue of...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR): FQ4 EPS of $0.64 beats by $0.16. Revenue of $946.7M (+33% Y/Y) beats by $43M. Shares +15.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 3 Comments
  • NTI

    Northern Tier Energy (NTI -1.8%) shares slide on word of a leak at its St. Paul Park refinery...

    Northern Tier Energy (NTI -1.8%) shares slide on word of a leak at its St. Paul Park refinery (Briefing.com) but begin to recover after subsequent reports say the facility has not been shut down and there was no evacuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • AIQUF

    Airgas (ARG -2.7%) says Executive Chairman Peter McCausland sold 1.2M shares of ARG common stock...

    Airgas (ARG -2.7%) says Executive Chairman Peter McCausland sold 1.2M shares of ARG common stock in a privately-negotiated overnight block trade in connection with personal financial planning matters. Following the sale, his beneficial ownership of ARG common stock is ~7M shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • NOK

    Checks indicate demand for Nokia's (NOK -5.2%) Lumia 920 is "solid" at AT&T, but well behind...

    Checks indicate demand for Nokia's (NOK -5.2%) Lumia 920 is "solid" at AT&T, but well behind demand for the iPhone 5 and Galaxy S III, says Raymond James' Tavis McCourt, who reiterates an Underperform. Moreover, McCourt thinks commentary from AT&T reps about the 920 "was very similar to the April launch of the Lumia 900, but with a lot more supply issues." He adds the 900 was on Amazon's top-10 bestseller list for 2 months, and that HTC and Samsung's Windows Phone 8 models also face supply problems. (previous: I, II, III)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 27 Comments
  • AXAS

    The Clinton Group sends a letter to Abraxas Petroleum (AXAS +9.6%) requesting asset sales, debt...

    The Clinton Group sends a letter to Abraxas Petroleum (AXAS +9.6%) requesting asset sales, debt reduction, production increases and more disclosures to stockholders on operating activities. AXAS shares have underperformed peers and have lost 30%-plus in six months, Clinton says; AXAS is "unfocused... owning too much non-operated acreage in too many geographies."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • DKL

    Delek Logistics Partners (DKL +3.5%) is initiated at BofA/Merrill and Goldman Sachs with Buy...

    Delek Logistics Partners (DKL +3.5%) is initiated at BofA/Merrill and Goldman Sachs with Buy ratings (I, II). DKL transports and stores crude oil and marketing refined products produced by parent company Delek U.S. Holdings (DK 1.8%) and other customers. DKL shouldn't trade at a discount to peers, BofA writes, given DKL's traditional assets and material dropdown potential from DK.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • OCZ

    OCZ (OCZ +15.8%) has shot higher in afternoon trading. Before today's open, the company...

    OCZ (OCZ +15.8%) has shot higher in afternoon trading. Before today's open, the company announced its Vector solid-state drive line, which features a new controller developed by subsidiary Indilinx (acquired in 2011). OCZ's failure to use an Indilinx controller in its Vertex 4 drives, launched earlier this year, was a concern for many. The first reviews (I, II, III) praise the Vector line's performance, but not its power consumption.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • TEVA

    Teva Pharmaceuticals (TEVA +0.9%) agrees to delay the introduction of generic versions of two...

    Teva Pharmaceuticals (TEVA +0.9%) agrees to delay the introduction of generic versions of two Gilead (GILD -0.9%) HIV drugs, Truvada and Viread, until June 1 or until a judge rules on the patent fight between the two companies. GILD sued TEVA in 2008 and again in 2010, claiming its FDA applications to make HIV drugs infringed four of its patents. The complaints also listed the HIV drug Atripla, which wasn’t cited in today’s filing.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • SCHN

    Schnitzer Steel (SCHN -2.7%) shares popped higher, then fell back again, after receiving an...

    Schnitzer Steel (SCHN -2.7%) shares popped higher, then fell back again, after receiving an upgrade from BofA/Merrill, which sees a more limited downside after disappointing FQ1 results likely were a trough. The ferrous and steel scrap recycling company said sales prices for ferrous metals were dropping due to significantly lower domestic utilization rates and the weak global economy.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • BCRX

    BioCryst (BCRX -4.7%) trades lower today following the announcement that its investigational new...

    BioCryst (BCRX -4.7%) trades lower today following the announcement that its investigational new drug BCX4161 has been put on a clinical hold due to manufacturing issues. JMP Securities cut the shares to Market Perform on the news.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • BWEN

    Broadwind Energy (BWEN +11.5%) powers higher after it wins a contract to supply an unnamed U.S....

    Broadwind Energy (BWEN +11.5%) powers higher after it wins a contract to supply an unnamed U.S. wind turbine manufacturer with ~$14M of wind towers for delivery in 2013. The order includes an option to buy up to $27M of additional towers to be exercised in early 2013. All towers would be produced in BWEN's facilities in Wisconsin and Texas.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • EXC

    Utilities (XLU +0.5%) could be poised for a rebound after a rough month. Yesterday, utility...

    Utilities (XLU +0.5%) could be poised for a rebound after a rough month. Yesterday, utility stocks jumped on the strength of electricity providers after Deutsche Bank upgraded Exelon (EXC +2%). Today, the sector again moves higher after ISI Group upgrades EXC to Buy from Neutral. Also: UNS +1.7%, NVE +1.6%, PPL +1.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 6 Comments
  • PLL-OLD

    Pall Corp (PLL-OLD -2.3%) slips today after BB&T cut the shares to Hold on valuation, citing...

    Pall Corp (PLL-OLD -2.3%) slips today after BB&T cut the shares to Hold on valuation, citing softening demand trends.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • LULU

    Shares of Lululemom (LULU +2.8%) make a speculative run higher as more reports trickle in...

    Shares of Lululemom (LULU +2.8%) make a speculative run higher as more reports trickle in indicating store traffic is strong at the start of the holiday shopping season. NBG's Brian Sozzi notes a positive trend at the retailer with discounting at low levels.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM | 3 Comments
  • MNST

    More on Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST) (previous): Goldman Sachs calls the response from the FDA...

    More on Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST) (previous): Goldman Sachs calls the response from the FDA on the energy drink health concerns relatively "benign" and encouraging for shareholders of the company. The common sense approach by consumers is likely to be moderation and increased oversight by parents - instead of anything resembling a ban or graphic warning labels. MNST +12.5% to $51.50.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM | 2 Comments
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM -5.8%) is cooling off today, thanks partly to Morgan Stanley's critical...

    Research In Motion (RIMM -5.8%) is cooling off today, thanks partly to Morgan Stanley's critical note. Kantar Comtech estimates RIM's U.S. smartphone share fell to a mere 1.6% (down 690 bps Y/Y) in the 12 weeks ending Oct. 28, and its EU5 share fell to 5.3% (down 690 bps). The more that RIM's base in developed markets diminishes, the tougher it will be to rack up huge BlackBerry 10 sales, since RIM will have to "convert" more users from rival platforms rather than simply sell them on an upgrade.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 2 Comments
  • RDC

    Rowan's (RDC -3.3%) new fleet contract status update includes a contract awarded to J.P. Bussell...

    Rowan's (RDC -3.3%) new fleet contract status update includes a contract awarded to J.P. Bussell for work in Malaysia at a day rate in the high $130s, above its previous rate in the $120s. RDC will record a reduction in revenue of ~$7M, offset by a $2M reduction in costs, in Q4 to defer previously recognized amounts due to Ralph Coffman's ~60 days of compensated shipyard time.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • MNST

    The FDA says its will use outside advisers to determine if highly caffeinated drinks pose a...

    The FDA says its will use outside advisers to determine if highly caffeinated drinks pose a serious health risk to young people or consumers with pre-existing heart conditions. The agency notes it didn't find any problems with common energy drink additives taurine and guarana, a statement that could be helping lift shares of Monster Beverage (MNST +9.3%) on the day.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 4 Comments
  • ADES

    ADA-ES (ADES +5.6%) says it's signed a contract for up to $20M to supply between 11 and 20...

    ADA-ES (ADES +5.6%) says it's signed a contract for up to $20M to supply between 11 and 20 activated carbon injection systems for a fleet of coal-fired generating plants owned and operated by a major U.S. power producer. Work will commence immediately and will ADES will recognize revenue from the project in the current quarter. Delivery is scheduled between late summer of 2013 and the end of 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • SIG

    Jewelry stocks race higher with word private equity concerns are sticking their nose into the...

    Jewelry stocks race higher with word private equity concerns are sticking their nose into the sector. Advancers: Signet (NYSE:SIG) +4.5%, Zale (NYSE:ZLC) +3.7%, Blue Nile (NASDAQ:NILE) +5.0%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • LNG

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +4.1%) shares spike on news its Sabine Pass export terminal project on the...

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +4.1%) shares spike on news its Sabine Pass export terminal project on the Texas-Louisiana border is proceeding ahead of schedule. LNG's first Sabine Pass liquefier is ahead of plan by six months, with the second liquefier tracking ahead of plan by 11 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM | 1 Comment
  • TI

    Egyptian billionaire Naguib Sawiris has officially proposed a €3B ($3.88B) cash infusion...

    Egyptian billionaire Naguib Sawiris has officially proposed a €3B ($3.88B) cash infusion for Telecom Italia (TI -3.4%), one he says should be open to all shareholders and take place near TI's current price of €0.70/share. That latter point can't sit well with Telefonica (NYSE:TEF) and the 3 Italian banks that own 22.4% of TI - they assign TI a valuation of €1.50/share on their books, and have made their opposition to Sawiris' plans clear. Sawiris, for his part, opposes a plan to spin off debt-laden TI's wireline assets, and wants to increase its Brazilian exposure.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • SXE

    Coverage of Southcross Energy Partners (SXE +1.7%) is initiated with high ratings by at least...

    Coverage of Southcross Energy Partners (SXE +1.7%) is initiated with high ratings by at least five firms (I, II, III, IV, V), including Baird, which says SXE's strong footprint, connecting one of the most prolific shale plays in the U.S. (Eagle Ford) and the largest petrochemical market in North America (the primary source of demand for NGLs), drives its strong fundamental outlook and bullish stance.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • AMRN

    Amarin (AMRN +5%) trades up after being awarded a patent for its fish oil pill Vascepa....

    Amarin (AMRN +5%) trades up after being awarded a patent for its fish oil pill Vascepa. Citigroup plays catch-up with the rest of the Street by initiating the shares with a Buy and a $20 price target on the news. Citi says that concerns over an exclusivity decision on the pill had put pressure on the stock and driven valuations near a "worst case" scenario, but that overhang has now been removed and the risk/reward is favorable. The firm adds that Vascepa has a near $1B commercial potential, even if AMRN has to launch the drug alone.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM | 5 Comments
  • MMR

    McMoRan Exploration (MMR -15%) shares plunge for a second day after reporting new difficulties...

    McMoRan Exploration (MMR -15%) shares plunge for a second day after reporting new difficulties at its Davy Jones field that add to doubts about its commercial viability. Capital One says MMR faces greater risk in light of yesterday's news, adding to negative comments from J.P. Morgan and RBC Capital. Other energy explorers with stakes in Davy Jones are impacted: PXP -0.8%, EXXI -1.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • VWDRY

    Talks between Vestas (OTCPK:VWDRY) and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries to build the biggest offshore...

    Talks between Vestas (OTCPK:VWDRY) and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries to build the biggest offshore wind turbine are bolstered by securing €900M in financing yesterday through 2015. Vestas’ negotiating power is now “slightly improved... It doesn’t increase the financial flexibility of Vestas, but it removes the short-term default risk." Shares -9.5% after jumping 22% yesterday.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • ACET

    Aceto Pharmaceutical (ACET +2.1%) gets a boost today from what appears to be a delayed reaction...

    Aceto Pharmaceutical (ACET +2.1%) gets a boost today from what appears to be a delayed reaction to yesterday's launch of its generic Clindamycin Palmitate Hydrochloride for Oral Solution, an FDA approved generic version of Pfizer's (PFE -0.6%) Cleocin Pediatric. U.S. market sales for Clindamycin Palmitate Hydrochloride - which is an antibiotic that is used to treat serious bacterial infections - were approximately $59M for the twelve months ended June 30.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • ANGI

    Angie's List (ANGI +2.3%) trades higher after Northland starts coverage at Outperform, arguing...

    Angie's List (ANGI +2.3%) trades higher after Northland starts coverage at Outperform, arguing investors the company's growth and margin potential more than offset its rising sales/marketing expenses. The firm notes service provider subscription renewals have an ~80% contributing margin, and that renewal rates for both service providers and members are above 70%. Also, Angie's estimated 2013 EV/sales multiple is at a 44% discount to its peer group's 4.5x.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • IPCI

    IntelliPharmaCeutics (IPCI -4.3%) slips despite reporting successful results of its initial...

    IntelliPharmaCeutics (IPCI -4.3%) slips despite reporting successful results of its initial Phase I clinical trial of a controlled-release form of pregabalin, for the treatment of neuropathic pain associated with diabetic peripheral neuropathy, postherpetic neuralgia, spinal cord injury and fibromyalgia. The results of the trial showed the drug was comparable to Pfizer's (PFE -0.6%) Lyrica, and the IPCI now plans to initiate additional Phase I trials in 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • ZION

    Zions Bancorp (ZION -2.6%) slides after the release of presentation materials for an investor...

    Zions Bancorp (ZION -2.6%) slides after the release of presentation materials for an investor conference later today. Sandler O'Neill - though noting guidance was as expected - plugs the numbers into its model and comes out with a lower Q4 earnings estimate. Of note: Zions expects Q4 net interest income 2-3% lower than Q3 as old loans reset to newer rates.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • ALLT

    Allot (ALLT +3.1%) is higher after Needham starts coverage with a Buy. The firm argues Allot's...

    Allot (ALLT +3.1%) is higher after Needham starts coverage with a Buy. The firm argues Allot's key product category (presumably deep packet inspection hardware) can deliver strong growth in the face of macro uncertainty and a tight capex environment. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • IMMR

    Immersion (IMMR +24.5%) is taking off after announcing it has settled its patent dispute with...

    Immersion (IMMR +24.5%) is taking off after announcing it has settled its patent dispute with Motorola Mobility (NASDAQ:GOOG). Immersion will be compensated for past shipments of Motorola devices containing basic haptic feedback tech, and a licensing deal has been reached for future shipments (terms are undisclosed). Investors are likely betting the settlement will pave the way for additional deals.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • CROX

    Goldman Sachs has shoes on its mind. Beyond lining up Crocs (CROX +7.3%) as its favorite name in...

    Goldman Sachs has shoes on its mind. Beyond lining up Crocs (CROX +7.3%) as its favorite name in the sector, the firm starts research on Sell-rated Steven Madden (SHOO -2.1%) and launches coverage on Deckers Outdoor (DECK -0.1%) and Wolverine World Wide (WWW -1.6%) with Neutral ratings. The biggest takeaway from the Goldman dip into the sector is that the firm isn't convinced Crox and Deckers Outdoor are weighed down with "broken fads" for headline products.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM | 2 Comments
  • YELP

    Yelp (YELP +2.9%) has opened higher after receiving an upgrade to Buy from Cantor. The firm...

    Yelp (YELP +2.9%) has opened higher after receiving an upgrade to Buy from Cantor. The firm argues Yelp's recent selloff, fueled by concerns about weak Q4 display ad sales guidance, is a buying opportunity, since Yelp's core local ad business remains healthy.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • CROX

    Shares of Crocs (CROX +6.5%) roar out of the gate in early trading, emboldened with a timely...

    Shares of Crocs (CROX +6.5%) roar out of the gate in early trading, emboldened with a timely initiation from Goldman Sachs at a Buy rating. The firm's $17 price target on CROX reps 38% upside potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM
  • SCHN

    Schnitzer Steel (SCHN -5.1%) expects ferrous average net selling prices to decline ~5% Q/Q, with...

    Schnitzer Steel (SCHN -5.1%) expects ferrous average net selling prices to decline ~5% Q/Q, with sales volumes down ~20%. SCHN says both export and domestic sales prices for ferrous metals during the first half of the current quarter dropped ~$50/ton from August levels, due to significantly lower domestic utilization rates and the weak global economy.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • CCCL

    China Ceramics (NASDAQ:CCCL) +22.7% premarket after announcing a strategic contract with China...

    China Ceramics (NASDAQ:CCCL) +22.7% premarket after announcing a strategic contract with China State Decoration Group, a wholly-owned subsidiary of the largest real estate construction contractor in China, China State Construction Engineering Corp.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • NEPT

    Neptune Technologies & Bioresources (NASDAQ:NEPT) -32% premarket as shares resume trading...

    Neptune Technologies & Bioresources (NASDAQ:NEPT) -32% premarket as shares resume trading after being halted since Nov. 8 when an explosion and fire destroyed its production plant in Quebec. As part of an action plan to resume operations and supply customers, the nutritional supplement maker will temporarily lay off ~70 workers while management and employees take salary cuts.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures are lower despite the latest deal to save Greece, while EU...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures are lower despite the latest deal to save Greece, while EU shares lose some of their earlier pizzaz, with Italian stocks even turning negative. The S&P benchmark is -0.2%. Worries over the fiscal cliff continue to weigh on sentiment, although pessimism from the OECD can't be helping. Ralcorp jumps 27% on news of its acquisition by ConAgra, which is +5%. Later: Consumer Confidence, State Street Investor Confidence Index, Richmond Fed Mfg, House prices
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • ACAD

    Premarket gainers: ACAD +190%. RAH +27%. OTC:CDTI +25%. GLW +8%. VICL +7%. CROX +7%. CAG +5%....

    Premarket gainers: ACAD +190%. RAH +27%. OTC:CDTI +25%. GLW +8%. VICL +7%. CROX +7%. CAG +5%. GNRC +5%.
    Losers: NBG -13%. MMR -11%. FRO -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • MMR

    McMoRan Exploration (NYSE:MMR) -8.5% premarket on top of yesterday's steep slide, as J.P. Morgan...

    McMoRan Exploration (NYSE:MMR) -8.5% premarket on top of yesterday's steep slide, as J.P. Morgan piles on with negative comments. Yesterday's update of its Gulf of Mexico activities only raised more questions about Davy Jones' ability to produce gas, the firm says, adding ominously: "we calculate that MMR has zero equity value." RBC also downgrades shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • ACAD

    Acadia (NASDAQ:ACAD) shares more than triple in value after being freed from a trading halt...

    Acadia (NASDAQ:ACAD) shares more than triple in value after being freed from a trading halt following news that its pimavanserin drug reduced psychotic episodes in patients with Parkinson's disease compared with a placebo in a Phase III trial. Acadia now needs to conduct another late-stage study to confirm the results - two similar trials failed to show a substantial fall in psychotic episodes.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
  • CDTI

    Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI) +11.1% premarket after receiving EPA verification for its...

    Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI) +11.1% premarket after receiving EPA verification for its Purifilter EGR emission reduction system, a diesel filter for the removal of particulate matter. Purifilter EGR addresses exhaust gas recirculation equipped heavy duty trucks currently subject to EPA retrofit requirements in the U.S., excluding California.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 AM
  • GLW

    Corning (NYSE:GLW) +8% after raising its guidance ahead of a conference presentation. Thanks to...

    Corning (NYSE:GLW) +8% after raising its guidance ahead of a conference presentation. Thanks to better-than-expected demand for LCD TVs and other electronics, Corning now expects its Q4 LCD glass volume to be "up in the mid-single digits" Q/Q, after previously guiding for volume to be flat to down slightly. Corning's Q4 pricing guidance is reaffirmed, but it thinks price declines will moderate in Q1. Also, Q4 Specialty Materials sales are now expected to rise 5% Q/Q (prior guidance was for flat growth) thanks to strong Gorilla Glass sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:23 AM | 3 Comments
  • CAG

    Shares of ConAgra (NYSE:CAG) move up 5.8% premarket after the company buys Ralcorp for a cool...

    Shares of ConAgra (NYSE:CAG) move up 5.8% premarket after the company buys Ralcorp for a cool $6.8B inclusive of debt. The quick take on the deal from analysts is that by beefing up its portfolio of private labels and realizing quick cost synergies, the company should see some significant benefits. Although ConAgra expects to maintain its annual dividend, the company notes share buybacks will be significantly reduced in the near future.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM
  • ACAD

    ACADIA Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACAD) reopens for trade, soaring 144% following the success of...

    ACADIA Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACAD) reopens for trade, soaring 144% following the success of its Phase III trial for Pimavanserin. "Home run for them," is Jason Napodano's quick take after looking over the data. Of particular interest, he says, is the testing showed no negative impact on motor function, unlike clozapine or quetiapine.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:05 AM

  • EU shares move higher in celebration of the Troika finally coming to a deal over Greece,...

    EU shares move higher in celebration of the Troika finally coming to a deal over Greece, although Asian stocks are mixed. Chinese shares fall to their lowest level since 2009, pulled down by weakness in growth-sensitive companies. Japan +0.4%, Hong Kong -0.1%, China -1.3%, India +1.4%. EU Stoxx 50 +0.6%, London +0.6%, Paris +0.6%, Frankfurt +0.7%, Milan +0.4%, Madrid +0.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 AM
